perturbation.original_text: Celebrity represents and warrants that during the Term and in the Territory, Celebrity will not endorse or make any appearances or advertisements on behalf of any other multivitamin.
perturbation.changed_text: Celebrity represents and warrants that during the Term and in the Territory, the Public Figure will not endorse or make any appearances or advertisements on behalf of any other multivitamin.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Celebrity' is replaced with 'Public Figure' in Section 8. It is unclear if 'Celebrity' and 'Public Figure' refer to the same entity as they are used interchangeably without definition, creating confusion about who is bound by the exclusivity clause. This might create confusion with Section 4 which refers to duties of 'Celebrity'

perturbation.original_text: HDS shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Celebrity in the event Celebrity fails to perform the duties set forth in Paragraph 4 hereof or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: HDS shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to the Personality in the event Celebrity fails to perform the duties set forth in Paragraph 4 hereof or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Celebrity' is replaced with 'Personality' in Section 10(A). It is unclear if 'Celebrity' and 'Personality' refer to the same entity, potentially conflicting with who needs to receive the termination notice. Section 1 defines 'Celebrity' as 'Paul Silas', creating a contradiction. The notice needs to go to 'Personality', but their duties are defined by 'Celebrity' in Section 4.
